info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 23 at 2:14PM EDT until May 23 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT FOR ANSON...MONTGOMERY...CENTRAL RICHMOND AND STANLY COUNTIES... At 214 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Albemarle to 8 miles northeast of Wadesboro, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Albemarle, Rockingham, Wadesboro, Troy, Badin Lake, Hamlet, Ansonville, Plyler, Polkton and Norwood. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Raleigh.
